step1.sentence: The driver sped up to merge onto the highway before the lane ended.

step2.story: The production line was running too slowly to meet the deadline. The manager asked the team to speed up without cutting corners on quality.

step3.story: Halfway through the marathon, Nina felt her energy returning after a long flat section. She decided to speed up and started passing runners who had gone out too fast at the start. By the final kilometer, she had moved up a dozen places. She crossed the finish line with her best time ever.

meaning.realUsageKo: 이동 속도, 작업 속도, 또는 진행 속도를 높일 때 씁니다. slow down의 반대말입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: speed(속도)와 up(강조, 증가)이 결합하여 속도를 높인다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 신체적 이동뿐 아니라 프로세스나 작업이 빨라질 때도 씁니다. 촉구하거나 격려할 때도 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Could you speed up a little? We are going to be late.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 조금 더 빨리 해줄 수 있어요? 늦을 것 같아요.
